word: MRS WHITE'S INTEREST IN THE OPENING WORK IN AFRICA DID NOT STOP THERE. IN 1889 WHEN S. N. HASKELL WENT TO AFRICA TO SPEND FIVE MONTHS IN VISITING, HOLDING MEETINGS, AND COUNSELLING CONCERNING THE WORK, HE RECEIVED LETTERS FROM ELLEN WHITE IN WHICH SHE DISCUSSED CERTAIN ASPECTS OF THE WORK OF THE MISSION AND THOSE LEADING OUT IN IT.
